review: I used this device to replace my WD Live TV, which, had issues losing connection to my wireless router. It is a long haul to this particular spot, and the extra antenna make all the difference. I never lose connection with this device.It doesn't quite have the depth of video apps I'd like to see and it doesn't stream from my PC, which is a bummer. But overall it is a great device, easy to use, with a good eye twords quality and simplicity

review: Before my Amazon Fire TV, I used to have a Roku 2, the amazon fire tv is the best media player I have bought ever, the configuration is so easy, I don't have to spend a lot of time and researching to install netflix (I'm located in Colombia), with the Roku I have to set-up a VPN for the installation of Netflix in my device, and tha was a pain in my a$$ (excuse my french), the set-up of the VPN was not difficult, but is annoying.With my amazon fire TV, the set-up of netflix was smooth, and it works perfectly.I used a lot Plex, to stream my media from a NAS to my media player, and have to pay: $4.99 for the Plex app on Amazon, (on roku it is free), if you are paying almost hundred bucks for a device, you should receive something like plex app free-of-charge.But I love my Amazon Fire TV, the control is great, the voice search works, even for my latinized english accent, but it only works for amazon and amazon prime content, I hope that in future updates it works for Netflix (at least).
